unnormalised: Urban planning in India needs a holistic approach. We must consider the lessons from haphazard growth in cities like Mumbai. The film "Wake Up Sid" subtly portrays urban alienation. Institutions like the National Institute of Urban Affairs can spearhead research. Prioritizing pedestrian-friendly zones, say in Connaught Place, is key. Investing Rs. 1000 crore in sustainable infrastructure can reshape urban landscapes. Planning for 2050 should be underway. Focus on last mile connectivity (5 km radius).
